title: CMAES: Distributed population eval harness
description:

Subtasks:

acceptance_criteria: - Population eval dispatches to N GPUs with device pinning.\n- Failed/timeout jobs retried or reported without hanging run.\n- Pop=10 over 8 GPUs completes and wall time ~1/8 of serial.

comments.author: ubuntu
comments.text:
Starting work on distributed population eval harness.

Agent Mail is not available in this environment (BEADS_AGENT_MAIL_URL not set), so I’ll use bd comments for coordination notes.

Plan:
- Implement torchrun/DDP controller+worker loop for evaluating CMA-ES populations with device pinning (rank -> cuda:local_rank).
- Add robust error handling (timeouts/retry) so a bad candidate doesn’t hang the run.
- Provide a CPU-only fallback mode for local testing.

comments.author: ubuntu
comments.text:
Implemented distributed population evaluation harness in `scripts/tune_bio_params.py`.

What’s in place:
- `optimize --distributed` runs under `torchrun`: rank0 runs CMA-ES controller, workers evaluate assigned candidates and `all_gather` fitness.
- Device pinning: in CUDA mode, each rank uses `cuda:{LOCAL_RANK}` (and calls `torch.cuda.set_device(LOCAL_RANK)` before init).
- Robustness knobs:
  - `--timeout-seconds` (per-candidate soft timeout checked during the eval loop; timeout => penalty)
  - `--retries` (retry candidate eval on exception/timeout; then penalty)
- Resume safety + logging via `--run-dir`:
  - `progress.jsonl` (per-gen)
  - `best_params.json` updated on improvement
  - `es_latest.pkl` + `es_gen_####.pkl` (CMA-ES pickles)
  - TensorBoard under `run_dir/tb` (scalars + fitness histogram + covariance heatmap image per gen)

Smoke tests (CPU-only here):
- `uv run torchrun --standalone --nproc_per_node=2 -m scripts.tune_bio_params optimize --distributed --device cpu --generations 1 --popsize 4 --steps 1 --batch-size 1`
- `uv run python -m scripts.tune_bio_params optimize --device cpu --generations 2 --popsize 4 --steps 10 --batch-size 4 --run-dir dev-ignore/cmaes_smoke`
- Resume: add `--resume` and bump `--generations`.

Note: this environment has no CUDA GPUs (`torch.cuda.device_count()==0`), so the multi-GPU walltime scaling acceptance item still needs verification on real hardware.

title: Security: Replace calculator eval() with safe AST evaluator

comments.author: ubuntu
comments.text: Found unsafe use of Python eval() in bio_inspired_nanochat/engine.py calculator tool. Even with __builtins__ removed, eval() can be exploited via object graph tricks. Replace with AST-based evaluator that only allows numeric ops (+-*/%//, parens, unary +/-) and a single safe string op: literal_string.count(literal_string). Keep existing timeout guard.

comments.author: ubuntu
